deck: Creator of Garfield, his real name is James Robert Davis.

deck: English comics author, Smyth created in 1954 the character 'Andy Capp' for the British newspaper Daily Mirror.

deck: Serbian artist, editor and publisher. Known for his artistic work for "Tarzan", "Il Grande Blek", "Ninja", "Stormy & Iceberg", "The Mask", "Espion de l'empereur"... Editor-in-chief of numerous top Yugoslav magazines (Yu strip, Stripoteka etc).

name: Pierre Fournier

deck: Argentinian writer, co-author of Loco Chàvez and Cybersix.

deck: Benito Franco Giuseppe Jacovitti was an Italian comics writer and artist.
name: Benito Jacovitti

deck: Writer of realistic comic books for adults, he has been an essential part in the Golden Age of french publisher Dargaud and specially in its modernization.
description: After working as a journalist for 7 years, he meets Rene Goscinny and starts working for PIlote magazine. His first important series is Ian MacDonald, in 1969, then he becomes editor in chief of the magazine. He writes mainly realistic comic books for adults adressing historical and politic subjects: Les innocents d'El Oro, L'Ile aux chiens, Medecins sans frontieres, Les gringos, Pasee simple, Sang d'Armenie... He published books about Jean-Michel Charlier and Rene Goscinny
name: Guy Vidal

description: He has worked in Spoon & White, Les innommables, Bob Marone, Bebert le cancrelat, Yoyo, Sambre, Le Marsupilami, Nuit blanche, Chaminou, Lolo et Sucette, Leonide et Spoutnika, Nicotine Goudron, Basil et Victoria, Pin-Up, Kid Lucky, Lucky Luke, Colt Walker, Les eternels, Yoni, etc etc
name: Yann

deck: Martin Lodewijk is a Dutch comic book artist and writer, he's famous for his saying 'I don't want to die as a simple advertisement artist, i want to die as a comic book artist'
description:
Career

Before Martin reached the age of 20 he had already published several stories. At the age of 16 he sold his first comic book story which unfortunately was never published. He wrote several comic books but ultimately decides to go working in advertising but he always remained active in the comic book world. At his later years he co-founded Eppo but also remained working in the advertisment world. Later in life he would turn his attention back to comic book stating that he didn't want to die as an advertisment artist, but that he wanted to die as a comic book artist.

Personal life

Martin Lodewijk was born in 1939 in  Rotterdam but due to his problems with Bronchitis at a young age he was forced to stay home a lot. But all was not lost as he discovered his love for drawing during this time. A passion that never went away.  A highpoint in his life was when he was knighted by the Dutch queen.
name: Martin Lodewijk

description: Christopher Leone started his career as a visual effects artist and CG animator, working on commercials, music videos, and feature films including X-Files: Fight the Future and Alfonso Cuaron's Great Expectations. He is currently directing commercials for Motion Theory in Venice, California, specializing in blending live action with CG animated characters.
name: Christopher Leone

description: Prior to her writing and producing career, Laura Harkcom worked as a creative executive for The Walt Disney Studios and Warner Bros. Studios. At Warner Bros., she rose through the ranks to ultimately oversee the feature animation creative affairs department. She was in charge of 17 projects in development, including films for Sandra Bullock, Quincy Jones, and George Clooney, as well as the D.C. Comics projects. Produced projects include the films SPACE JAM, OSMOSIS JONES, and the critically acclaimed THE IRON GIANT.
name: Laura Harkcom

aliases:
Daniel Rodolphe
J. Rodolphe
Rodolphe Daniel Jacquette
deck: Writer. Also credited as J. Rodolphe.
name: Rodolphe D. Jacquette

deck: Comic artist based in France, who has recently had Spin Angels published in the English speaking countries by Marvel.
description:
History

 
Background

Part Cambodian, French & Italian, Pierre-Mony Chan was born in Paris.  He grew up reading European comics such as Asterix, the Smurfs and TinTin and would often try to copy favourite drawings.  Upon his first taste of Japanese anime, he decided that he could do more than just reproduce drawings.   
 
As a teenager he was inspired by the dynamic action and the modern styles that he found in Japanese manga, especailly the works of Masamune Shirow.  When in college he joined the APA (Amateur Press Association) known as GraphAPA, where he met other creative individuals who exposed him to more modern and dynamic styles as well as that in anime & manga.  Spurred on by these new experiences, he dropped all of his technical-knowledge based courses and opted to focus solely on anything & everything art-based at Émile Cohl.  There, he studied for four-years and gained his diploma in illustration four years later, in 1988.  

Published Works

Pierre-Mony Chan's first hired work as an artist was to create designs for the video game company, Kalisto.  There, he met writer Jean-Luc Sala who was a project manager.  When Kalisto's finances began to falter, Sala advised Chan to be part of a board for the Festival of Angoulême where they met with Mourad Boudjellal.  As editor of the French comic book publisher Soleil, Boudjellal hired both Pierre-Mony Chan and Jean-Luc Sala to produce Cross Fire.    The success of Cross Fire has led to another Chan & Sala collaboration, Spin Angels, which has been picked up for distribution in English speaking countries by Marvel.
name: Pierre-Mony Chan

issues.name: Théodore Poussin dans la gueule du requin !

name: Ming Doyle

deck: Artist, most known for his covers for The Phantom.
name: Hans Lindahl

deck:
Also known as Michael Tierres.
Member of "Team Fantomen".
description:
Claes Reimerthi is a literary, comic writer and comic historian.

He has written for most of the major Swedish-produced series, including Phantom (Fantomen), 91:an and Little Fridolf. He is currently magazine Phantom's lead author and responsible for the creative development of that series of comic books.

During 2000-2003, he wrote a number of episodes of the American version of The Phantom newspaper. Claes Reimerthi has teamed up with notable artists like Dick Giordano, Hans Lindahl, Joan Boix and Paul Ryan, among others, to create excellent Fantomen stories in the last two decades.

He is an honorary member of The Scandinavian Chapter of the Lee Falk Memorial Bengali Explorers Club.
name: Claes Reimerthi

deck: A collaborative artistic/writing duo consisting of A. Honda and S. Nagano.  They are best known for their work on Astro Boy and the manga adaptation of Nintendo's The Legend of Zelda series.
name: Akira Himekawa
